metadata.synopsis: After the party, this companion is still trying to come down from all the energy, and with a good enough bond it is possible for the player avatar to flirt and unlock a romance option. Gale has been drinking wine, but is not drunk - line delivery shouldn't convey this unless expressly indicated in the VO notes. The wine is mentioned in a few spots, but it shouldn't influence his diction.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Recruit Gale to your partyRecon: oe qnight NIGHT_GoblinHunt_TieflingCelebration_1ad8c357-2695-4d5c-b5f9-8b8c07803121Go to camp and chat with him

12.speaker: Gale
12.text: A beautiful night, don't you think? Nothing like a brush with destruction to make one appreciate the majesty of the celestial canvas.
12.context: NodeContext: Wistful, missing an old friend

0.speaker: Gale
0.text: It's a view I would once have shared with my companion. Though definitely unaccompanied by such revelry.
0.context: NodeContext: Wistful, missing an old friend

75.speaker: Gale
75.text: She preferred it when we were alone, curled up before a crackling hearth with some ancient, esoteric tome between us, ink glinting in the firelight...
75.context: NodeContext: Recalling a rich, warming memory

122.speaker: Gale
122.text: Not everyone is comfortable being alone with their thoughts. Though I never felt alone with a book in my hand. Or with her for company.
122.context: NodeContext: Being generous towards the player's lack of interest, then returning to his reflective mood

57.speaker: Player
57.text: I hope you aren't talking about Mystra again...

21.speaker: Player
21.text: Who are you referring to? A former lover, perhaps?

61.speaker: Gale
61.text: I speak of Tara, my tressym, assistant, my constant companion through all the ills and tribulations my hubris has thrust upon me.

127.speaker: Gale
127.text: She'd be most impressed by our efforts saving these tieflings. Proud, even. And I've given her little to be proud of recently.

110.speaker: Gale
110.text: After I was afflicted with my condition, I locked myself in my tower for an entire year. I was inconsolable, wallowing in my self-inflicted tragedy.

42.speaker: Gale
42.text: I'd given up on myself, but Tara never did. It was her encouragement, her research that led me to my treatment. Once we knew that magically-infused items were the key, she went out to find them for me. She saved my life.

29.speaker: Gale
29.text: After so long being cared for by someone else, it feels good to have repaid the favour. Not directly to Tara, but to these poor tieflings. I'm sure she would approve.

107.speaker: Player
107.text: She must be very smart, to have done all that.

28.speaker: Gale
28.text: 'Smart' does her a disservice. She's a fine wizard in her own right, though somewhat held back by her lack of opposable thumbs.

59.speaker: Gale
59.text: You remind me of her somewhat. The same sharp tongue. And sharp teeth.
59.context: NodeContext: Not too heavy on the 'sharp teeth' - I'm not sure it's guaranteed that Gale knows Astarion is a vampire.

117.speaker: Gale
117.text: You remind me of her somewhat. You share her pragmatic streak.

126.speaker: Gale
126.text: You remind me of her somewhat. You share a certain nobility of spirit.

116.speaker: Gale
116.text: You remind me of her somewhat. You share her fierceness, and her passion.

63.speaker: Gale
63.text: You remind me of her somewhat. Something in the way you roll your eyes when I speak...

4.speaker: Gale
4.text: You remind me of her somewhat. An expression you both share - when she gives in to her more feline qualities, a mouse trapped beneath her paw...

50.speaker: Gale
50.text: I wish she were here for me to make a formal introduction, but I would never ask her to undertake such a journey. She is safer at home.

56.speaker: Gale
56.text: Besides, she was always telling me I needed to spread my wings, so to speak. Find mortal friends, instead of hanging onto Mystra's coattails. So that's what I'm doing. I hope.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: Bad luck on that front - I'm actually a nymph in disguise...

125.speaker: Gale
125.text: Very funny. But as we all know, nymphs are sticklers when it comes to their bathing routines. You, my friend, haven't been near a fresh spring in a tenday or more.

9.speaker: Gale
9.text: Not that I don't appreciate your musk. I actually rather like it...
9.context: NodeContext: Getting carried away, accidentally revealed he's kind of interested in the player romantically

118.speaker: Gale
118.text: Well, this seems as good a time as any for me to stop babbling on.

112.speaker: Player
112.text: So I remind you of your pet? How romantic...

22.speaker: Gale
22.text: I assure you, were you to meet Tara you would see the comparison for the flattery it is. But perhaps that's not a point worth labouring further.

17.speaker: Gale
17.text: Suffice it to say, I think rather a lot of you. And there aren't many on this plane who I'd give such high praise.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: Don't stop there. What else do you like about me?

25.speaker: Player
25.text: I'm flattered. Is your good opinion so hard to come by?

58.speaker: Gale
58.text: One doesn't become the most powerful archmage in Waterdeep and lover to the goddess of magic herself by having low standards.

51.speaker: Gale
51.text: I assure you, when I tell someone they're wonderful - I mean it. And you are wonderful.
51.context: NodeContext: sincere, giving way the depth of his growing feelings fro the player

76.speaker: Player
76.text: Being mentioned in the same breath as your pet isn't the compliment you think it is...

68.speaker: Gale
68.text: Then let me say it more plainly -

74.speaker: Gale
74.text: I think you're rather wonderful. And that's not a word I waste on anyone unworthy of it.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: Don't stop now. What else do you like about me?

123.speaker: Gale
123.text: Were I to recite that list, I fear we'd still be here at dusk tomorrow. Many things, I assure you, but a conversation better saved for another time.
123.context: NodeContext: Cheerfully deflecting your question, though it's clear he would have more to say

19.speaker: Player
19.text: Actually, I was thinking we'd be wonderful together...

100.speaker: Player
100.text: The feeling's mutual - you're a wonderful friend. Though usually more... erudite.

47.speaker: Gale
47.text: Wine is to wit as meat is to... to... oh, I can't bloody remember it. There I go, then, proving your point.
47.context: NodeContext: Trying to sound impressive, a bit flustered

115.speaker: Gale
115.text: Perhaps we'd better leave it at that. My ineloquent tongue isn't worthy of your ear at present.
115.context: NodeContext: Cheerfully accepting the brush off, not taking it personally

113.speaker: Gale
113.text: With my condition as volatile as it is, I fear any undue, er, excitement, may tip it over the edge. So to speak.

53.speaker: Gale
53.text: Go - enjoy your evening. Nothing better for the heart than a good night's rest, and mine is gladdened to know I'll have the pleasure of your company again come morning.

43.speaker: Gale
43.text: Go, indulge in the frivolities - they're good for the heart. And mine will be all the lighter, to see you enjoying yourself.

80.speaker: Player
80.text: I can't say I share the same high opinion of you, Gale.

99.speaker: Gale
99.text: Always bringing such candour to our conversations. Some would think twice about mocking Gale of Waterdeep, but you just go straight for the gut.
99.context: NodeContext: Playing along, making fun of himself

108.speaker: Gale
108.text: I like that about you. It's one of your rarer qualities, though I fear my ego can take no more of it tonight.
108.context: NodeContext: Cheerfully accepting the brush off, not taking it personally

89.speaker: Player
89.text: If this is an attempt at flirting, you should stop. I'm not interested.

14.speaker: Gale
14.text: Right. Understood. You shall hear no more on the subject from me.

91.speaker: Gale
91.text: Consider this budding romance thoroughly nipped. Though I hope our friendship need not come to such an abrupt end.

97.speaker: Player
97.text: I'm not interested in you, Gale. Not in that way.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: What if she doesn't like me?

45.speaker: Player
45.text: She sounds like a fine animal. One I'd be honoured to know.

37.speaker: Gale
37.text: She'll love you. So long as you don't rub her belly. She hates it when anyone does that.

64.speaker: Player
64.text: Do you like having your belly rubbed?

33.speaker: Gale
33.text: The pleasures I experienced in Mystra's embrace go far beyond the thrill of having one's tummy tickled. I remember once, she took the smallest piece of the Weave and made it into -
33.context: NodeContext: Taking the question seriously, missing the flirtatious side of it

105.speaker: Gale
105.context: NodeContext: Realising that the player was flirting, getting flustered

41.speaker: Gale
41.text: I see. Then perhaps we see each other in the same light after all. A resplendent one, flush with warmth and anticipation, but one which I must shy away from, for now.
41.context: NodeContext: Still flustered, but pleased to learn you like him romantically. Then getting to the point - he can't do anything until the orb is dealt with

72.speaker: Gale
72.text: You know what, I think I've clearly had far too much wine. And you've had nowhere near enough. I think this is a conversation best held back on - for now.
72.context: NodeContext: Flustered, hesitating to explicitly say what he thinks you were offering, then backtracking altogether

90.speaker: Player
90.text: She sounds great. But I was hoping I meant more to you than an animal companion...

114.speaker: Player
114.text: Not as much as I hate talking about cats. Is there nothing else on your mind?

88.speaker: Gale
88.text: Not an animal lover? Nobody's perfect, I suppose.
88.context: NodeContext: Sincere - he's offering something that has meaning, a sign of how much he likes you

13.speaker: Gale
13.text: Nonetheless, your finer qualities are remarkably plentiful.

65.speaker: Gale
65.text: Sadly not. If I'm being entirely honest, my social circle is rather small. More of a dot. Or a pinhead.

27.speaker: Gale
27.text: I've got aquaintances, certainly. Plenty of colleagues. But friends? Those are precious indeed.

131.speaker: Gale
131.text: I hope, though we've only known each other for a short time, I might be able to count you among that number?

96.speaker: Player
96.text: Of course. I hoped we might be more than friends...

92.speaker: Player
92.text: That depends. What do you like about me?

18.speaker: Player
18.text: Friends with the mighty Gale of Waterdeep? I'd be honoured.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: I wouldn't call this a friendship. More a series of necessary interactions.

26.speaker: Gale
26.text: Please - feel free to enjoy yourself elsewhere. No doubt there are others here who offer more welcome company.

54.speaker: Gale
54.text: You remind me of her somewhat. There's a steeliness to you, an unwavering tenacity even in the face of, to be frank, quite dire odds.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: You must have been lonely, with only Tara for company...

78.speaker: Gale
78.text: Sometimes. But I imposed it upon myself, after all. I set up enough wards to keep an army at bay, never mind the few colleagues who sought to inquire about my welfare.

79.speaker: Gale
79.text: Tara did her best to keep my spirits up, of course, but there's only so much one tressym can make up for one's entire social circle. And she was often gone seeking items to treat my condition.

62.speaker: Gale
62.text: You're the first person I've spent any significant time with in a year or more. Spending time in your company, I realise that I may have left behind the greater part of my wit, and sensitivity, in my tower.

40.speaker: Gale
40.text: I'm glad. To know you enjoy my company is, well, it's rather wonderful actually. I'd be loathe to waste the time of someone who's become rather important to me.

104.speaker: Player
104.text: No one came to visit you during your confinement?

95.speaker: Player
95.text: I rather like the Gale stood in front of me. In fact, I'd like to see more of him...

82.speaker: Gale
82.text: She'd be proud to see me keeping such fine company - the saviour of those poor tieflings, no less. And I've given her precious little to be proud of recently.

77.speaker: Gale
77.text: She has a good heart, and she would recognise the same in your actions here. I'm sure she'd approve of me lending myself to your efforts.

102.speaker: Player
102.text: Are you... are you talking about your cat?

129.speaker: Gale
129.context: NodeContext: Shocked at the player's suggestion. Note: this is a statue in Waterdeep's religious burial district

55.speaker: Gale
55.text: Tara is not any cat. She's a tressym. And given your confusion, I'm guessing you've never met one. They're brilliant creatures - fine company for any self-respecting wizard.

16.speaker: Gale
16.text: Don't worry about me - I'm quite content to enjoy the party from here. Go, enjoy yourself.

46.speaker: Gale
46.text: Even in such fraught times as these, there is peace to be found in the stillness as evening draws in.
46.context: NodeContext: Wistful, missing an old friend

15.speaker: Gale
15.text: I used to while away many hours just like these with my companion, though in far comfier surrounds.
15.context: NodeContext: Wistful, missing an old friend

94.speaker: Gale
94.text: Don't let me drag you away. Enjoy yourself - you earned a night of revelry.
